verses.verse: "Why<WH4069> are times<WH6256> not stored<WH6845> up by the Almighty,<WH7706> And why do those who know<WH3045> Him not see<WH2372> His days<WH3117>?
"Some remove<WH5381> the landmarks;<WH1367> They seize<WH1497> and devour<WH7462> flocks.<WH5739>
"They drive<WH5090> away<WH5090> the donkeys<WH2543> of the orphans;<WH3490> They take<WH9111> the widow's ox<WH7794> for a pledge.<WH9111>
"They push<WH5186> the needy<WH34> aside<WH5186> from the road;<WH1870> The poor<WH6041> of the land<WH776> are made to hide<WH2244> themselves altogether.<WH3162>

"Behold,<WH2005> as wild<WH6501> donkeys<WH6501> in the wilderness<WH4057> They go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> seeking<WH7836> food<WH2964> in their activity,<WH6467> As bread<WH3899> for [their] children<WH5288> in the desert.<WH6160>
"They harvest<WH7114> their fodder<WH1098> in the field,<WH7704> And they glean<WH3953> the vineyard<WH3754> of the wicked.<WH7563>
"They spend<WH3885> the night<WH3885> naked,<WH6174> without<WH1097> clothing,<WH3830> And have<WH369> no<WH369> covering<WH3682> against the cold.<WH7135>
"They are wet<WH7372> with the mountain<WH2022> rains,<WH2230> And they hug<WH2263> the rock<WH6697> for want<WH1097> of a shelter.<WH4268>
"Others snatch<WH1497> the orphan<WH3490> from the breast,<WH9582> And against<WH5921> the poor<WH6041> they take<WH9111> a pledge.<WH9111>
"They cause [the poor] to go<WH1980> about naked<WH6174> without<WH1097> clothing,<WH3830> And they take<WH5375> away<WH5375> the sheaves<WH6016> from the hungry.<WH7457>
"Within<WH996> the walls<WH7791> they produce<WH6671> oil;<WH6671> They tread<WH1869> wine<WH3342> presses<WH3342> but thirst.<WH6770>
"From the city<WH5892> men<WH4962> groan,<WH5008> And the souls<WH5315> of the wounded<WH2491> cry<WH7768> out; Yet God<WH433> does not pay<WH7760> attention<WH7760> to folly.<WH8604>
"Others<WH1992> have been<WH1961> with those who rebel<WH4775> against the light;<WH216> They do not want to know<WH5234> its ways,<WH1870> Nor<WH3808> abide<WH3427> in its paths.<WH9350>
"The murderer<WH7523> arises<WH6965> at dawn;<WH216> He kills<WH6991> the poor<WH6041> and the needy,<WH34> And at night<WH3915> he is as a thief.<WH1590>
"And the eye<WH5869> of the adulterer<WH5003> waits<WH8104> for the twilight,<WH5399> Saying,<WH559> 'No<WH3808> eye<WH5869> will see<WH7789> me.' And he disguises<WH7760> <WH5643> his face.<WH6440>
"In the dark<WH2822> they dig<WH2864> into houses,<WH1004> They shut<WH2856> themselves up by day;<WH3119> They do not know<WH3045> the light.<WH216>
"For the morning<WH1242> is the same<WH9191> to him as thick<WH6757> darkness,<WH6757> For he is familiar<WH5234> with the terrors<WH1091> of thick<WH6757> darkness.<WH6757>

"They are insignificant<WH7031> on the surface<WH6440> of the water;<WH4325> Their portion<WH2513> is cursed<WH7043> on the earth.<WH776> They do not turn<WH6437> toward<WH1870> the vineyards.<WH3754>
"Drought<WH6723> and heat<WH2527> consume<WH1497> the snow<WH7950> waters,<WH4325> [So does] Sheol<WH7585> [those who] have sinned.<WH2398>

"A mother<WH7358> will forget<WH7911> him; The worm<WH7415> feeds<WH4985> sweetly<WH4985> till he is remembered<WH2142> no<WH3808> more.<WH5750> And wickedness<WH9390> will be broken<WH7665> like a tree.<WH6086>
"He wrongs<WH7462> the barren<WH6135> woman,<WH6135> And does<WH3190> no<WH3808> good<WH3190> for the widow.<WH490>
"But He drags<WH4900> off the valiant<WH47> by His power;<WH3581> He rises,<WH6965> but no<WH3808> one has<WH539> assurance<WH539> of life.<WH9132>
"He provides<WH5414> them with security,<WH983> and they are supported;<WH8172> And His eyes<WH5869> are on their ways.<WH1870>

"They are exalted<WH7426> a little<WH4592> while,<WH4592> then they are gone;<WH369> Moreover, they are brought<WH4355> low<WH4355> and like everything<WH3605> gathered<WH7092> up; Even like the heads<WH7218> of grain<WH7641> they are cut<WH9268> off.<WH9268>
"Now if<WH518> it is not so,<WH645> who<WH4310> can prove<WH3576> me a liar,<WH3576> And make<WH7760> my speech<WH4405> worthless<WH408>?"
